newsitem.title: DENMARK: Scandinavian charter airline in FLS deal.
newsitem.headline: Scandinavian charter airline in FLS deal.

text.p: Scandinavian charter airline Premiair said on Wednesday it signed a 75-100 million crown aircraft maintenance contract with Danish engineering group FLS Industries' British-based FLS Aerospace unit.
It said the contract would take effect immediately running until the year 2000, involving the maintenance of Premiair's four U.S.-built DC-10 passenger aircraft.

"The newly extended facilities at FLS Aerospace's Manchester Airport base means quicker and more efficient maintenance for this part of our fleet than before," Premiair managing director Tom Clausen said in a news statement.

For the past two years FLS Aerospace's Danish section has carried out in Denmark maintenance of aircraft for Scandinavian Leisure Group's Premiair, Scandinavia's biggest air charter operator, which is owned by Britain's Airtours.
